column4: ok - so i take it that u are using this thing called gnome-network manager to manage your network.
so have you configured your network using the command line before?
yes and no.. I've learned how to do it from using Backtrack a Slackware live cd.. but I use gnome-network-manager for the WPA2 support
whats the correct way to do DHCP.. I learned dhcpcd but that doesnt work in Ubuntu
